title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
Speaker Pelosi said the House will move to impeach Trump this week if Pence and the president's cabinet don't act to strip him of his powers over the riot at the U.S. Capitol.

---

Silicon Valley's moves to eject Trump from social media represent a display of power the companies have avoided making for nearly four years. Now they must reckon with what comes next.

Apple and Amazon halted support for Parler, dealing a major blow to a social-media service that has soared in popularity among conservatives.

---

JPMorgan is pausing all corporate political-action-committee donations to Republicans and Democrats for six months after last week's riot at the Capitol.

---

White House officials pushed Atlanta's top federal prosecutor to resign before the Georgia runoffs because Trump was upset he wasn't doing enough to probe unproven claims of election fraud.

---

Authorities believe they have identified the location of the two black boxes of the Sriwijaya Air jet that crashed into the Java Sea, carrying 62 people.
